name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, ex rel. Alan PURSELL, Relator, Appellant, v. James M. MORGAN, Warden at Western Penitentiary, and William R. Cunningham, District Attorney, Appellees
name_abbreviation: Commonwealth ex rel. Pursell v. Morgan
docket_number: Appeal No. 101 Western District Appeal Docket 1991

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, ex rel. Alan PURSELL, Relator, Appellant, v. James M. MORGAN, Warden at Western Penitentiary, and William R. Cunningham, District Attorney, Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
The appeal in the above-captioned case is hereby dismissed without prejudice. The trial court is ordered to proceed with the appellant’s presently pending, counseled Petition pursuant to the Post-Conviction Relief Act.
LARSEN, J., notes his dissent.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: William A. Cunningham, Dist. Atty., Kenneth A. Zak, Asst. Dist. Atty., Erie, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
615 A.2d 732
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, ex rel. Alan PURSELL, Relator, Appellant, v. James M. MORGAN, Warden at Western Penitentiary, and William R. Cunningham, District Attorney, Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Sept. 22, 1992.
Decided Nov. 10, 1992.
Alan Pursell, pro se.
William A. Cunningham, Dist. Atty., Kenneth A. Zak, Asst. Dist. Atty., Erie, for appellees.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, JJ.
